thread.title: Shaq Makes Fun Of JaVale McGee's Hair; McGee Compares Him To A Minstrel
thread.title_full: Shaq Makes Fun Of JaVale McGee's Hair; McGee Compares Him To A Minstrel

author: Patrick Redford
title: Shaq Makes Fun Of JaVale McGee's Hair; McGee Compares Him To A Minstrel

persons.name: shaq makes fun of javale mcgee

text:
Go to permalink Photo: David Zalubowski/ AP 
Warriors center JaVale McGee and Shaquille O’Neal have a unique relationship, in that Shaq makes fun of McGee on TV, and McGee gets angry at him. Advertisement 
McGee’s resentment began back in the 2011-12 NBA season, when Shaq debuted his TNT segment “Shaqtin’ a Fool,” which frequently mocked a younger and much more folly-prone McGee when he was on the Wizards. In fact, McGee won the “Shaqtin” MVP in each of the segment’s first two seasons. He is the only repeat winner. 
McGee has always taken Shaq’s gleeful roasting personally. He went on the show in 2013 to call Shaq a bully and said, “I don’t watch ‘Shaqtin’ a Coon.’” He spoke to the San Jose Mercury News this offseason and lamented that fans think he is a “dumb person” because Shaq “tried to ruin someone’s career.” Advertisement 
With all that history to keep in mind, the latest back-and-forth happened today, when Shaq made fun of McGee’s new haircut: 
McGee responded an hour later by insinuating that Shaq was a minstrel, and comparing him to Bert Williams, a black vaudeville entertainer who performed in blackface and played stereotypically degrading parts during his career. 
McGee seems to have used a screenshot of this tweet from December: 
It seems safe to say that McGee might not get invited back on Inside The NBA for a while. Recommended Stories
